turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: How do you do, Miss Viridiana!

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Is anything the matter, Mr. Mayor?

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: You cannot leave ...

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: There's been an accident.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: Come with me.

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: Why are you crying?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: Don't invent stories; go to bed.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: A black bull came.

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: A black bull!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: It's a very big one.

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: Very, very?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Yes -- very, very big!

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: He couldn't get through the door, then?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: He came in through the cupboard.

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: You little liar! Get out of here!

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: I'll box your ears if you don't show some respect for the dead! You mustn't play under this tree.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Don Jaime loved to watch me skip.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Have you repaired the windows of the dormitories?

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: They shut all right now. And the blankets are ready.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: What's going on, Moncho?

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: This louse is looking for trouble.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: In you go! Moncho, lead the way!  You stay here.

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: But, miss ...

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: You have decided to leave, Moncho.

turns.speaker: MONCHO
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I can't do anything to make you stay? These people annoy you, isn't that it?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Mother?

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I've just had a letter from your uncle. He won't be able to come when you take your vows.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: All right, Mother.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I hardly know him. I saw him only once, some years ago. I can't even remember him.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: In any case he's asking you to come and stay with him.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I don't want to leave the convent, Mother.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: I'm afraid that his health is not good. He's your only relative and you ought to say farewell to him before taking your vows. You will certainly never see him again.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: But why does he want to see me? He has never bothered about me.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: He has paid for your studies and your maintenance, and he has just sent your dowry. Does that mean so little to you, Viridiana?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I have no desire to see the world again, but if you order me to...

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: The retreat will start soon. You can leave tomorrow morning.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Good morning. You weren't expecting me, were you?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Mother.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Ever since yesterday, when we heard by chance about the tragedy, we have been very anxious for you. Why didn't you write? I would have come immediately.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I had so many things to think about!

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: A suicide is horrible. I know. But you should have told me.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Is there some grave impediment which prevents you from taking your vows? There must be something.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I have nothing to reproach myself for. All I know is that I've changed. With all my strength, which is not much, I will follow the road that the Lord has shown me. One can also serve outside a convent.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: Are you aware of the pride there is in what you're saying?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Forgive me if I have offended you.

turns.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
turns.text: You are forgiven. Goodbye.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Give the little girl to me. Come here, sweetheart. Are you ready?

turns.speaker: PELON
turns.text: When you are, miss.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Good, then let's go!

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Don't talk like that!

turns.speaker: PELON
turns.text: I'll talk the way I want to. I've had enough of this.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Would you mind telling me what I did wrong to you to deserve your insults?

turns.speaker: PELON
turns.text: I've had a gutful of this.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: If you want to stay you'll have to exercise a little self-control, and be a bit more humble to everybody.

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: She has the face of an angel. What a pity you can't see her.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Right, let's go.  And keep the compliments to yourself. I don't like them.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: What about you, Manuel?

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: I'm only good at making people laugh.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: That's all right; we all laugh here, but not at you; I'll see to that.

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: She looks like a sick marrow!

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Don't pay any attention to him. It's very good.

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: Ask the priest, miss.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: That's enough.  Go join the others, and don't come back here.  And you'll have to control your temper.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: Welcome, miss. I'm Ramona, Don Jaime's servant.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Ah! Pleased to meet you.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: How do you feel?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I have a headache.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: That will soon pass. It's nothing.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: What happened to me?

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: You fainted last night after supper. The master and I carried you here.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Have I slept long?

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: Oh, you slept well; don't worry.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Good morning, Rita. How are we today?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Today, a good girl.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Could I trouble you for my glass of milk?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Yes, yes, I saw you!

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: How did you see me?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: From the terrace.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: It's very wicked to spy. Why did you do it?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I'm going to the hen house. Are you coming with me?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: No, I don't want to.

turns.speaker: ALEXIEV
turns.text: ) Daryl Lindenmeyer was only here briefly, one semester at most. But he was singularly the most brilliant student I ever had in a classroom. He created programs so beautiful, so lyrical, they were almost like symphonies...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Can you tell us what's on the disc?

turns.speaker: ALEXIEV
turns.text: ) There is one program with approximately 1.3 million lines of programming. It is thoroughly secured, which is not surprising considering Lindenmeyer created it.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: In English, please.

turns.speaker: ALEXIEV
turns.text: I accidently triggered a protection mechanism which erased the entire program.

turns.speaker: ALEXIEV
turns.text: It was very wellhidden. There was no way to see it until it was too late.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: It's not your fault. We appreciate you trying.

turns.speaker: ALEXIEV
turns.text: Look, I feel bad about this, so I'm going to try to look into the programming of his Maestro teaching tool for you.  ) I've had one sitting around for years. Maybe I can learn something that you'll find useful.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You son-ofabitch, I'm going to kill you.

turns.speaker: ALEXIEV
turns.text: Me? What did I do?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I'm sorry, I thought you were somebody else.

turns.speaker: ALEXIEV
turns.text: I've discovered something about Lindenmeyer'5 Maestro teaching tool I thought you should know...  The harm done to the music students who used the device  it was not by accident. The machine was designed explicitly for that purpose. Lindenmeyer intended to hurt the kids using it.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Jesus Christ.  I know who the dominant personality is.  Lindenmeyer.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: My first two pairs of convicts suffered the same fate.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Why wasn't I told?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: We don't know how, but Sid 6.7 made himself into an android.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: You mean a nanotech synthetic organism.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Recognize this? How would you like your old job back?

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Catch him and your record's clean.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: This is the newest technology approved for general implementation. It's called a locater implant. Every parolee gets one.  We're going to know where you are every second for the rest of your life.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: If you try to run, I'll hunt you down and kill you myself.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Yes or no, Mr. Barnes?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: There's already a task force out looking for Lindenmeyer. Every other officer in the city will be hunting Sid right along with you.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: But only you will know he's not human.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: What are they doing in Los Feliz?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Madison lives two blocks from their present location.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Why would they be going there?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: I wish we could hear them.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Barnes wouldn't kill two innocent guards.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: He would slaughter eight people sitting in a room, but not two prison guards?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Do I need to remind you what happened to his wife? To his daughter?  I will stake my reputation that Barnes didn't kill those guards.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: You already have staked your reputation.  Mayor Bennett and I have been friends a long time. Since Grimes tried to kill him, it doesn't take a rocket scientist to come to the conclusion that Sid 6.7 might go after him, too.  Bennett's Re-Election Rally is tomorrow night and we already have enough trouble on our hands with one psychotic on the loose.  The fail-safe online, yet?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Why'd.. .you pull me out?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Donley started experiencing the attack for real. If I hadn't gotten you out, the same thing would have happened to you.  You may not believe this, Parker,

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: What the hell did you have to shoot the busboy for?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: He was a computer program for crissake.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: You were supposed to act as if everything was real.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Real, my ass. It's an overblown game.  Anybody ever catch that fucking psycho?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Before you, nobody else had gotten close enough to Sid 6.7 to take a shot at him. Hell, nobody else had even been able to start tracking him before he got to them first.  New scar  you making it okay in there?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I'm getting by.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: But with the six months off I get for being your guinea pig, I've only got to survive another 17 years, 5 months, and 23 days.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Don't give up, Parker. Not ever.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You know those cheesy Christmas cards of your family under that tree in your back yard you keep sending me every year?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: What about them?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Do me a favor  keep sending them.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You're wasting your time. I'm not going to play any more of your goddam games.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Parker Barnes, I'd like you to meet Crime Czar Elizabeth Deane.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: It's too early in the morning for me to be cordial. You got any coffee?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: These were taken inside LETAC an hour ago. Pretty pictures, aren't they?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I've seen worse.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Name was Clyde Reilly. Hardware specialist.  LETAC surveillance cameras got a picture of the perp as he left the building.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Jesus Christ.  Can you kill it?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: If you can catch him.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: She's going to help you understand what makes Sid 6.7 tick.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: What she's going to do is get in my way.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: This is the personnel file on the programmer, Lindenmeyer. There might be something in it you can use.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: She wasn't part of the deal, Cox.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Fine  you want to stay here?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Officers in Toluca Lake just found an affluent couple...completely gutted.  So were the first two cops to arrive on scene.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Their weapons missing?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Sid 6.7 is now armed.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Where's my gun?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Don't worry, they have no idea where you are.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You sonofabitch. How could you let them put the implant in my head? How?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: She saved your life, Parker. She didn't have to, but she did.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Then I guess we're even.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: When this is over, will you get this goddam thing out of my head?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: On my life, I promise you I will.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: If you're lying, I'll hunt you down and kill you myself.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: ... illegal search of Lindenmeyer' s duplex. Eleven civilian vehicles damaged or destroyed. Twentyfour citizen complaints. And the calls are just starting to come in...  I forgot what it's like to have you on the streets.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Any sign of Lindenmeyer?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: None. He could be hiding, he could be helping Sid, or could be in little pieces on Santa Monica beach.  Any idea what Sid's going to do next?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Until we know what new influences are affecting him, we can't be sure.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: In other words, we collectively don't know shit.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I should have told him.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Don't blame yourself. In your shoes, I don't think I would have told Parker, either.  So do you think Grimes has become the dominant personality?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I'm not sure. My guess is that's what Sid wants us to think.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: You think he's smart?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Captain, I'm afraid of how smart Sid 6.7 is.  But I'm even more afraid of what's he's becoming.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: There is no way Parker killed those guards. No way.

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: I think we both know who did.  What's so urgent?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I need your help--

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Why didn't anybody tell me?!

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I don't set policy.  You have the key?

turns.speaker: COX
turns.text: Give me 30 seconds, then flip every switch you can reach.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Ms. Deane, you wanted to see me?

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: We have an emergency situation which requires somebody with expertise in criminal psychology. Under the authority vested in me by the President, I'm giving you temporary reassignment.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: What's the assignment?

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: You're going to put your theories to practice. I'm sending you into the field.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: That's also where Mr. Barnes lost his arms to Mathew Grimes' booby trap. What's your point, Dr. Carter?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Letting a lunatic like Parker Barnes loose in the free world is like lighting a fuse. At some point, he will go off -- you saw what happened in the simulator. The risk to the public is unacceptably dangerous.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Not if you're with him every step of the way.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: The man played judge, jury, and executioner with eight people's lives. He lost control and is capable of doing it again.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: I understand the risks involved here. But there is nobody better qualified to go after Sid 6.7 than Barnes. And, there is nobody who knows him better than you. If a situation becomes volatile, you will find a way to quell it. I have complete confidence in you.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: I watched your simulation, Mr. Barnes. Very impressive. You know, you're the only one to ever go up against Sid 6.7 who is still alive.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Only because I got pulled out early.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Nobody else ever got anywhere near him. Nobody else... understands him like you do.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Think you can do it?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Not from in here.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: This is a full pardon. It authorizes your immediate release.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: What happens if I can't catch him?

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: If Sid 6.7 hasn't killed you, we throw you back in here and you serve out the rest of your sentence.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: How do you know I won't run?

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Barnes, where the hell have you been?!

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Trying to find out where the bomb is. Where the hell have you been?

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: What did you find out?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Call off the manhunt looking for me. I didn't kill the transport guards.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: It's already been called off. Witnesses confirmed you weren't the shooter.  Did you find out where the bomb is?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: No, but I've confirmed the reelection rally is the target.  How much C-4 is missing?

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Enough to level an entire city block.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: If I were you, I'd get every demolition team in the city searching in and around the Biltmore Hotel.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Demolition teams have searched everywhere in and around the hotel. I don't know where...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Sid is smart enough to know you'd check everywhere in the immediate area. Whatever the device is, he's probably got it timed to move into position just before it detonates.  Have the demo teams check every subway tunnel, water pipe, gas pipe, and sewer pipe that goes under, over, or into the arena.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: You know how much man power you're talking about?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You're the highest law enforcement official in the country. Use the fucking army if you need to.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: This better not be a wild goose chase.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Or what, you'll authorize my death a second time today?

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Don't forget, convict, if this psycho isn't stopped, you go right back to rotting in a prison cell.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: What did Cox pull him out early for?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Barnes used to work for him when he was still a cop in the field, remember?

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Don't remind me.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: What the hell happened?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Lindenmeyer developed neural connectors that tap directly into the nervous system. If the simulator isn't calibrated properly, experiencing death in this level of VR is like experiencing death within a dream. The experience becomes real.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Simulations are supposed to give participants practice in realistic, dangerous scenarios while protecting them from the risks they are exposed to in the real world.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I was assured the problem was corrected.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: It makes me nervous just seeing him in a uniform.  I will never forget the first time I saw the photos from the crime scene.

turns.speaker: DEANE
turns.text: Neither will the public.  The media has caught wind of his pardon. Unless Mr. Barnes starts giving me some tangible results, I'm going to put him back in his cage.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: You embarrassed me in front of the highestranking law enforcement official in the country.  Do you have any idea how much money you just cost me?

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: The reason you insisted on testing my system with prisoners is because of the increased risks involved with increased realism.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Of the six prison inmates you've tested  all of whom have had at least some military or survival training - only Mr. Barnes is still breathing.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: I'm still making adjustments...

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: You've had a yearandahalf to make all the adjustments you want, Lindenmeyer.  ) Elizabeth Deane does not give second chances. Neither do I. You're fired.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: I'M WHAT?!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: You are to turn over the Sid 6.7 program, and all its documentation, for immediate destruction. Is that understood?

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: I understand... I understand perfectly.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: How does he know who I am?

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: He hears...everything.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: As a matter of fact, I do.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: HEY!!!

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: Show's over unless I get to see what you've been working on after hours.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: I haven't been working on anything.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: Do I get to see it or not?

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Bastard...  Sheila, don't go anywhere. I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: Get that fucking thing away from me!

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: You're...such a wimp.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Watching your VR people Auto Reset gave me the idea.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: It's nanotechnology, isn't it? Machines the size of molecules...

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Coordinated by polymer neural net.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: It feels so.. .real.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: It's better than real. It's synthetic flesh. Synthetic blood. Synthetic organs...  It's a physiological machine.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: This is supposed to be years away.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: As far as the public is concerned, it is. The reason you got fired, and I got my second demo into production, is I'm a lot smarter than you. I never give my best stuff away.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: How do you kill it?

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Separate the character module from the neural net...

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: ... and you get nanodeath.  Don't worry, I've got a bunch of other ones.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: Amazing. I hate to say it, but it is.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: I know.  I'm ready to incubate something a little more advanced than a coldblooded reptile. If you want to experience the future, meet me in my office in 15 minutes. And bring the Sheila 3.2 character module with you...

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: You need a maid.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: What I need is a nymphomaniac.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: I told you this would work.. By setting back the clocks, he has absolutely no idea he's in virtual reality. He still thinks he's in the real world.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: What's wrong with Parker?

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: How should I know?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Show me his physical sensory level.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: I wonder how that...

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Turn it down!

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: He's developing a hemisphere imbalance.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Talk so I can understand.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: If I don't adjust the level of neural information each side of his brain is receiving, he won't be able to walk when I take him out of VR.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Then fix it.

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Don't be angry with me, Daryl.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: Did you recognize the son-of-a bitch who got away?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Should I have?

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: Think hard -- it'll come to you...

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: All they want to produce around here is mediocrity!

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: True genius is rarely rewarded within its lifetime.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: It was you, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: It was me, what?

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: You amped the neural connectors back up, didn't you?  You're the reason the convict died. You're the reason I got fired!

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: I couldn't just let them make you bring down my degree of difficulty. I'm a triple-twisting, double back flip off the high platform, not a swan dive.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: My God...

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Which God would that be, the one who created me, or the one who created you?  In your world, the Lord giveth, and the Lord taketh away. But in my world, the one who gave me life doesn't have the balls to stop a couple of bureaucratic assholes from taking it away.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: What do you expect me to do, put your character module in my pocket and just walk you out of here?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: I had something a little different in mind.  Instead of just playing Peeping Tom with Reilly, why don't you get him to show you what he's been working on after hours?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: She's some of your finest work, Daryl.

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: All my work is my finest.

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: You catching my drift?

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: I think I understand what you have in mind...

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: SID  NO!!!

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: What do you expect me to do, thank him?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: I am beautiful, aren't I?

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: Of course you are.

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: How can I ever thankyou for bringing me back to life a second time, Daryl?

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: Help me get out of here.

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Glad to...

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: You made me a composite of 183 of the most vicious people who ever lived.  What do you think I'm doing?

turns.speaker: LINDENMEYER
turns.text: I'm begging you...please don't kill me! Please!

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Don't worry. Through me, you will live forever...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You actually listen to all those tapes?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: No, I just like the effect a tape recorder has on you.  How you feeling today?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: A little less than yesterday.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: In other words, par for the course.  How do you feel about the simulation you participated in yesterday?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: John died.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I know. I was there. I saw the whole thing.  If I was your therapist, I would have advised you against putting yourself back into that kind of situation.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You're not my therapist. You're hear to study me. Face it  I'm nothing more than a lab rat to you.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: That's not true, Parker.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: If I had died yesterday, you'd have already dissected my brain and analyzed it to see if I carry any genetic predisposition toward violence.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: What was going through your mind when you killed the busboy?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Not much. He was just a computer program. Nothing more.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: You didn't see the expression you had on your face when you pulled the trigger. But I did.  You kind of liked it, didn't you? That thrill of going over the edge again. Of taking out an innocent bystander or two, as long as you got the target...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Go to hell.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: It was just like before, wasn't it? Wasn't it?  But you are making progress. Instead of killing seven people to get the one you're after, this time there was only one other person involved.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Enough!

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I need to know what snapped in you. What made you capable of it. You have to make me understand.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I don't have to do anything except survive. And it's taking everything I've got just to do that.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I don't need a babysitter.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: What you need is a collar.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Every day for the last five years, I told myself someday I would be out here again. No more bars. No more guards. No more fights just to stay alive.  Every day for the last five years, I told myself that lie.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: It wasn't a lie.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Every time I said it, it was. I never really thought I was going to make it.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Fine. Never felt better in my life.  See, I'm a good liar.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: You ready for this?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Don't worry. If I can't handle it, I'll just kill everybody.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: He was reenacting Charles Manson's LaBianca murders.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Manson didn't kill the first cops to arrive on the scene.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Whoever did this wanted to do Charlie one better  to improve upon what was already done.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Charlie? You say that like you're close, personal friends.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I've spent over 50 hours interviewing him.  Charlie killed Leno and Rosemary LaBianca because of the ugly way the members of his family had butchered Sharon Tate. After seeing the blood bath on television, he wanted to show them how it should be done.  The question is, what does Charlie have to do with Sid 6.7?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I know who would know.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Learn anything from Lindenmeyer's file?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: He had a twin brother who was a musical child prodigy who died in an electrical accident at age eight. Lindenmeyer went into an emotional shell until was 17. All he did day and night was play the violin.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: What happened when he was 17?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Every music school in the country rejected him and he turned to computers.  Stay here.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: You've got a problem with me carrying a gun?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Do me one favor  if you shoot at anything, make sure I'm nowhere near it.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Checking my pulse. It's elevated.  You enjoy frightening me, don't you?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You've studied me, now I'm studying you. Seems only fair, don't you think?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: This Lindenmeyer's a real piece of work.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Maybe after they catch him, you should write a book about him...
